abstract: California Senate is expected to pass resolution that will replace statue of 18th-century Catholic priest Rev Junipero Serra with one of astronaut Sally Ride in Capitol's National Statuary Hall Collection in Washington, DC, where each state is allowed to have two sculptures; proposal to install Ride's statue has received bipartisan support, and proponents say it will address lack of representation of women and gay people in collection.
lead_paragraph: If legislators have their way, the statue will replace that of the Rev. Junipero Serra, the 18th-century Catholic priest, in the National Statuary Hall Collection in Washington.

headline.main: California Seeks to Make Way for Statue of Sally Ride in U.S. Capitol
headline.print_headline: California Seeks to Make Way for Statue of Sally Ride in the Nation’s Capitol

snippet: If legislators have their way, the statue will replace that of the Rev. Junipero Serra, the 18th-century Catholic priest, in the National Statuary Hall Collection in Washington.
